Class RUBTClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • RUBTClient

  • public class RUBTClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main client class for CS352, BitTorrent project 1 The program is designed to use a command-line argument the name of the .torrent file to be loaded and the name of the file to save the data to Opens the .torrent file and parse the data inside and decodes the data Send an HTTP GET request to the tracker at the IP address and port specified by the TorrentFile object. Download the piece of the file and verify its SHA-1 hash against the hash stored in the metadata file All communication is done over TCP.
    Author:
    ZHANPENG HE, MANISH PATEL, JOHN NELSON

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        GivenTools.BencodingException
        This is the main method that is called upon program startup, this method is tasked with validating the program's arguments and then instantiating the other classes need to run the program. When the download is finished this method verifies that it has completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        args - he name of the .torrent file to be loaded and the name of the file to save the data to, using the proper path and file extensions.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        GivenTools.BencodingException

      • announce

        public static java.util.Map<java.nio.ByteBuffer,java.lang.Object> announce(java.lang.String event,
                                                           java.lang.String peerId,
                                                           int port,
                                                           int uploaded,
                                                           int downloaded,
                                                           int left,
                                                           java.lang.String infoHash)
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                           GivenTools.BencodingException
        Send an HTTP GET request to the tracker at the IP address and port specified by the TorrentFile object to obtain Tracker Response Object
        Parameters:
        event -
        peerId - Our peerId
        port - Port on which we are listening.
        uploaded - Amount we have uploaded
        downloaded - Amount we have downloaded
        left - Amount we have left to download
        infoHash - Info hash of the torrent we want.
        Returns:
        Tracker response, which is a Map object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        GivenTools.BencodingException
